div.p:
PASSIO VERBIGENAE QVAE NOSTRA REDEPTIO CHRISTI NOS DVCIT AD SVMMI TECTA PATERNA POLI.
AD SPECTATOREM.
Aspice Sadleri Spectator prouides quae sit Docta manus, nulla quae peritura die Utile Pictori monumentum est, vtile passim Sculptori, auleis vtile purpureis Utile si nitido argentum perfuderis auro, Vtile si vestes Purpura rubra notet.
D. Favol canebat

IOAN: SADLER EXCVD: MARC: GERAERD: FIGVR:
IOAN: SADLER EXCVD: MARC: GERAERD: FIGVR:

The Passion of Christ, he who was born of the word, our redemption, leads us to the father’s house of the highest heaven.
TO THE VIEWER.
Behold, viewer of Sadler, foresee that hand is learned, which is to die on no day. The work is useful to the painter, useful everywhere to the image cutter, it is useful for purple hangings. It is useful if you would bathe silver with shining gold, useful if it inscribes robes with ruddy purple.
D. Favolius sang
